node.title: Are we caught in a game of snakes and ladders with coronavirus variants?
node.alt: Two women hold sage and sprinkle holy water while wearing face masks and white dresses.
node.description: A pattern of borders opening and then closing has become a familiar one over the past 22 months, threatening economic recovery and leaving citizens fatigued. Is it a sign we will always live with restrictions and uncertainty?
node.content:
["All across Asia, the emergence of the Omicron variant has put long-held plans to reopen and return to a new normal in doubt.", "Just as other variants\u00a0disrupted carefully planned coronavirus road maps throughout the region, the uncertainty over Omicron has led to governments recalibrating\u00a0their policies.", "South Korea, for example, halted its return to normal last week, with\u00a0health authorities announcing\u00a0they were extending restrictions amid soaring COVID-19 infections.", "Indonesia, which had reopened its borders to tourists in mid-October despite only a third of its population being fully inoculated, also tightened its border control.\u00a0It has also extended quarantine and limited movement on strategic toll roads.", "The Philippines, meanwhile,\u00a0back-pedalled on a plan to allow some vaccinated foreign tourists to enter the country.", "And in what was one of the more drastic measures taken, on\u00a0November 30 Japan shut its borders to foreigners, including short-term business visitors, foreign students and workers, despite earlier relaxing restrictions.", "Even states that are moving to live with the virus,\u00a0like Singapore,\u00a0have signalled they may tighten their restrictions if necessary. Although others\u00a0like Thailand\u00a0remain committed to reopening plans.", "The responses throughout the region are different, justified as a way of buying time until scientists know more about the new variant. The measures are also less strict than those taken in\u00a02020.", "", "
The daily lives of people around the world have again been disrupted by a new variant, prompting questions about when the pandemic will end.(Reuters: Jorge Silva)
", "But last week, World Health Organization (WHO) director-general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus warned the lack of a consistent and coherent global approach had\u00a0\"resulted in a splintered and disjointed response, breeding misunderstanding, misinformation and mistrust\".", "The response has also\u00a0highlighted the ongoing battle to regain normalcy as new developments\u00a0emerge.", "A pattern of countries opening and then closing has become a familiar one over 22 months. The uncertainty has\u00a0threatened\u00a0economic recovery and left\u00a0citizens with pandemic fatigue.", "But is this a sign the end point of\u00a0the pandemic is a long way off? Will restrictions and disruptions to daily life become the new normal? This is what experts had to say.", "
A game of snakes and ladders
", "Scientists have long warned we are in a race against time to get global transmission rates low enough to stop the emergence and spread of new variants.", "Already we are seeing variants developing advantageous mutations, prolonging the pandemic and contributing to its severity.", "Omicron may just be the latest example, its dozens of mutations prompting fears it has the potential to make existing vaccines less effective.", "Reflecting on this recently,\u00a0Singapore's Health Minister, Ong Ye Kung, compared the situation to a game of snakes and ladders.", "", "
Singapore is adopting a wait-and-see approach to the\u00a0Omicron variant.(Reuters:\u00a0Edgar Su)
", "\"We don't know what is the next throw of the dice and which square we will land on,\" he said.", "Mr Ong used the game to explain how there were a few possibilities that lay ahead. One was if Omicron was more infectious, more harmful and vaccines did\u00a0not work well against it:", "\"Then we have stepped on the snake square,\u00a0and we will go down, which will set us back a long way,\" he said.", "The other scenario was if\u00a0Omicron was more infectious, but turned\u00a0out to be milder.\u00a0Then, \"in time, a less harmful virus may dominate over Delta\", he said.", "\"That is actually a positive development. Then\u00a0we would have landed on the ladder square and maybe even take a leap forward in our transition to living with COVID-19,\" Mr Ong said.", "\"Many scientists believe this is actually one possible natural evolutionary direction of viruses.\"", "The problem facing leaders as they wait to find out which way the pendulum swings on Omicron is what to do in the interim.", "While many countries have acted swiftly, imposing travel bans, it has raised questions about whether nations may need to adjust their expectations about\u00a0what living with the virus looks\u00a0like.", "WHO regional director for the western Pacific\u00a0Takeshi Kasai has warned: \"Every community must prepare for new surges in cases.\"", "\"People should not only rely on border measures. What is most important is to prepare for these variants with potential high transmissibility,\" he told a virtual briefing.", "Jaya Dantas, a professor of international health in the School of Population Health at Curtin University, suggested\u00a0consistency would\u00a0be key going forward.", "She said\u00a022 months into the global pandemic, people were tired, and there could not continue to be \"knee-jerk reactions in closing borders and\u00a0locking down states\".", "\"If we give them clarity, saying that \u2026 we\u00a0still have COVID, we will have variants, we just don't know \u2014 none of us can predict what will be the [next] variant\u00a0\u2014 [then] all we need to do is be vigilant and have measures in place \u2026 and keep our vaccination rates up.\"", "On the other hand, Catherine Bennett, chair of epidemiology at Deakin University, said border control,\u00a0along with testing,\u00a0might\u00a0continue to be justifiable in future.", "But she said\u00a0countries might\u00a0also have to be adaptive about what \"living with a virus is\".\u00a0", "\"Not just managing what we have today, but actually knowing how to respond to the ever-changing virus \u2026 in a way that doesn't debilitate us,\" she said.", "\"Because the real damage is done if we keep putting preventions in place that end up not being proportionate to the virus.\"", "She suggests we have\u00a0got to get better at \"quickly reading the risk\u00a0and the threat\u00a0and\u00a0knowing when it is something we should respond to\". But one country appears to be going its own way.", "
Asia \u2014 and the world's \u2014 COVID outlier
", "As others in the region moved towards a model of \"living with the virus,\" Beijing doubled down on a \"zero tolerance\" approach that has kept it isolated from much of the world.", "And the rise of Omicron has not changed its\u00a0plans.", "", "
Omicron has prompted countries to reintroduce travel restrictions but China is sticking with its COVID-zero policy.(Reuters:\u00a0Aly Song)
", "Instead,\u00a0an editorial titled China is the strongest line of defense (sic) in the face of new COVID-19 variant that was published\u00a0in The Global Times\u00a0\u2014\u00a0a Communist Party mouthpiece \u2014\u00a0argued the West was now paying the price for its selfish policies.", "\"Western countries control most of the resources needed to fight the COVID-19 pandemic,\" it wrote last month.", "\"But they have failed to curb the spread of the virus and have exposed more and more developing countries to the virus.\"", "So far, China's measures have kept it largely COVID free but the country has\u00a0suffered several Delta outbreaks in recent months.", "And with about 90 per cent of China's population believed to be vaccinated,\u00a0questions have emerged about the efficacy of its homegrown vaccines.", "A study by Peking University mathematicians recently found China could not afford to lift travel restrictions without more efficient vaccines\u00a0or specific treatments.", "In a report by the Chinese Centre for Disease Control and Prevention, which was published in China CDC Weekly, the author's predicted China's daily new cases would reach at least 637,155 if it adopted the United States' pandemic strategy.", "While the restrictions in China might enjoy the public's support, the costs of the nation's\u00a0COVID-zero strategy are also likely to hit eventually.", "International financial firms warned in October that, without a\u00a0\"clear and meaningful exit strategy\",\u00a0China risked losing its status as a financial hub.", "Yet China's exit strategy might not be the only one under a cloud of doubt amid the emergence of Omicron.", "
Will Omicron impact Christmas?
", "Around the world people are now asking themselves the same questions: Is it still safe to go on holiday? Is Christmas cancelled? Will this pandemic ever end?", "In almost no time at all, Omicron had\u00a0spread to more than\u00a057\u00a0countries as of December 9.", "It is not clear yet whether the variant will be as prevalent as the Delta strain, which is in over 170 countries, but many fear\u00a0it could be just as transmissible.", "But there may be a silver lining.", "\"The same happened with the Alpha variant and the Beta variant and the Gamma variant and the Lambda variant:\u00a0After they spread to a certain number of countries, the spread didn't go beyond those countries,\" Professor Dantas said.", "", "
Thailand banned\u00a0entry from eight African countries due to the new Omicron variant.(Reuters:\u00a0Athit Perawongmetha)
", "It's very likely we will see new variants emerge and each will have to be closely monitored.", "But in Professor Dantas's\u00a0view, so far our vaccine strategies and other public health measures\u00a0are working and they can protect us against future variants.", "\"The more familiar we are with a virus, the more success we've had in containing it, the more we understand it, then we are in a much stronger control position,\"\u00a0Professor Bennett said.", "\"But we're still in that transition.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
